title: Add documentation for custom sources
description:
Document how to create and register custom document sources.

## Documentation Sections

### User Guide
- How to add HTTP collections
- How to configure authentication
- Troubleshooting common issues

### Developer Guide
- Implementing DocumentSource protocol
- Creating custom EntityResolvers
- Registering sources at runtime
- Best practices for change detection

### Examples
```python
# Example: Notion resolver
class NotionResolver:
    def __init__(self, api_key: str):
        self.client = NotionClient(api_key)
    
    def list_entities(self, resource_type: str, query: dict):
        if resource_type == 'pages':
            for page in self.client.search(query.get('database_id')):
                yield EntityInfo(id=page.id, title=page.title)
    
    async def fetch_entity(self, resource_type: str, id: str):
        page = await self.client.get_page(id)
        return EntityContent(
            content=page.to_markdown(),
            title=page.title,
            metadata={'last_edited': page.last_edited_time}
        )

# Register and use
registry.entity_resolvers.register('notion', NotionResolver(api_key))
# Now can create: entity://notion/pages?database_id=xxx
```

## Location
- Update existing docs or create docs/ directory
- Add docstrings to all public APIs
- Include in --help output for CLI

Write tests for source abstraction
description:
Comprehensive test coverage for the new source abstraction layer.

## Test Files
- `tests/unit/sources/test_base.py` - Protocol conformance tests
- `tests/unit/sources/test_registry.py` - Registry routing tests
- `tests/unit/sources/test_filesystem.py` - FileSystem source tests
- `tests/unit/sources/test_http.py` - HTTP source tests (mocked)
- `tests/unit/sources/test_entity.py` - Entity source tests
- `tests/integration/test_source_indexing.py` - End-to-end tests

## Test Scenarios

### Registry
- Register and resolve by scheme
- Unknown scheme raises error
- Case-insensitive scheme matching

### FileSystemSource
- List documents with glob pattern
- Fetch content with various encodings
- Handle missing files gracefully
- Incremental change detection

### HTTPSource (mocked with respx/httpx)
- Sitemap parsing
- ETag/Last-Modified handling
- Auth header injection
- Retry on transient failures
- Rate limit handling (429)
- HTML to markdown conversion

### EntitySource
- Resolver registration
- URI parsing
- Fetch delegation to resolver

### Integration
- Index filesystem collection (existing behavior)
- Index HTTP collection end-to-end
- Mixed collection update

title: Implement actual vector storage in store_embedding()
Update Collection model for source configuration
description:
Extend Collection to support different source types with type-specific configuration.

## Schema Changes
```sql
ALTER TABLE collections ADD COLUMN source_type TEXT DEFAULT 'filesystem';
ALTER TABLE collections ADD COLUMN source_config TEXT;  -- JSON blob
```

## Updated Collection Type
```python
@dataclass
class Collection:
    id: int
    name: str
    # Legacy fields (kept for filesystem compatibility)
    pwd: str
    glob_pattern: str
    # New source fields
    source_type: str = 'filesystem'  # 'filesystem', 'http', 'entity'
    source_config: dict | None = None
    created_at: str
    updated_at: str
    
    def get_source_uri(self) -> str:
        """Compute source URI from config."""
        if self.source_type == 'filesystem':
            return f'file://{self.pwd}'
        elif self.source_type == 'http':
            return self.source_config['base_url']
        elif self.source_type == 'entity':
            return self.source_config['uri']
```

## Migration Strategy
1. Existing collections get source_type='filesystem'
2. source_config remains NULL for filesystem (uses pwd/glob_pattern)
3. New sources store config in source_config JSON

## CollectionRepository Updates
- Update create() to accept source_type and source_config
- Add validation per source type
- Keep backward-compatible create() signature for filesystem

Add source metadata tracking table
description:
Create database schema for tracking source-specific metadata (ETags, timestamps, etc.).

## Schema Addition
```sql
CREATE TABLE source_metadata (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    document_id INTEGER NOT NULL REFERENCES documents(id),
    source_uri TEXT NOT NULL,
    etag TEXT,
    last_modified TEXT,
    last_fetched_at TEXT NOT NULL,
    fetch_duration_ms INTEGER,
    http_status INTEGER,
    content_type TEXT,
    extra_metadata TEXT,  -- JSON blob for source-specific data
    UNIQUE(document_id)
);

CREATE INDEX idx_source_metadata_uri ON source_metadata(source_uri);
```

## Repository
`src/pmd/store/source_metadata.py`

```python
class SourceMetadataRepository:
    def upsert(self, doc_id: int, metadata: SourceMetadata) -> None
    def get_by_document(self, doc_id: int) -> SourceMetadata | None
    def get_by_uri(self, uri: str) -> SourceMetadata | None
    def needs_refresh(self, doc_id: int, max_age_seconds: int) -> bool
```

## Migration
- Add migration script to schema.py
- Handle existing documents (no metadata = filesystem source)

title: Add tests for title-only document handling
Implement basic CLI structure and collection commands
Add unit tests for service layer
Index title as FTS body for title-only docs
Define DocumentSource protocol
description:
Create the core protocol/interface that all document sources must implement.

## Location
`src/pmd/sources/base.py`

## Protocol Definition
```python
class DocumentReference:
    """Reference to a document from a source."""
    uri: str              # Canonical URI (e.g., 'file:///path/to/doc.md')
    path: str             # Relative path for storage
    title: str | None     # Optional title hint
    metadata: dict        # Source-specific metadata (etag, last-modified, etc.)

class DocumentSource(Protocol):
    """Protocol for document sources."""
    
    def list_documents(self) -> Iterator[DocumentReference]:
        """Enumerate available documents."""
        ...
    
    async def fetch_content(self, ref: DocumentReference) -> str:
        """Fetch document content."""
        ...
    
    def supports_incremental(self) -> bool:
        """Whether source supports efficient change detection."""
        ...
    
    async def check_modified(self, ref: DocumentReference, stored_hash: str) -> bool:
        """Check if document has changed since last fetch."""
        ...
```

## Design Notes
- Use Protocol (structural subtyping) not ABC for flexibility
- Make fetch_content async to support network sources
- DocumentReference should be serializable for caching

title: Implement HTTPSource for web documents
description:
Create HTTP/HTTPS document source for fetching web content.

## Location
`src/pmd/sources/http.py`

## Configuration
```python
@dataclass
class HTTPConfig:
    base_url: str
    # Discovery
    sitemap_url: str | None = None
    manifest_urls: list[str] | None = None
    # Auth
    auth_type: Literal['none', 'bearer', 'basic', 'api_key'] = 'none'
    auth_token: str | None = None
    api_key_header: str = 'X-API-Key'
    # Behavior
    timeout_seconds: int = 30
    max_retries: int = 3
    respect_robots_txt: bool = True
    # Content
    content_selector: str | None = None  # CSS selector for main content
    allowed_content_types: list[str] = ['text/html', 'text/markdown', 'text/plain']
```

## Features
1. **Discovery modes**:
   - Sitemap.xml parsing
   - Explicit manifest (list of URLs)
   - Single document mode

2. **Change detection**:
   - ETag support
   - Last-Modified header
   - Fallback to content hash

3. **Content extraction**:
   - HTML to markdown conversion
   - CSS selector for main content area
   - Metadata extraction (title, description)

4. **Error handling**:
   - Retry with exponential backoff
   - Rate limit detection (429)
   - Connection pooling

## Dependencies
- httpx for async HTTP
- beautifulsoup4 for HTML parsing
- Consider markdownify for HTML->MD

title: Implement SourceRegistry for URI routing
description:
Create a registry that routes URI schemes to appropriate source implementations.

## Location
`src/pmd/sources/registry.py`

## Design
```python
class SourceRegistry:
    """Routes URI schemes to source implementations."""
    
    _handlers: dict[str, type[DocumentSource]]
    
    def register(self, scheme: str, source_class: type[DocumentSource]) -> None:
        """Register a source class for a URI scheme."""
    
    def resolve(self, uri: str, config: SourceConfig) -> DocumentSource:
        """Create source instance for given URI."""
    
    def supported_schemes(self) -> list[str]:
        """List registered schemes."""

# Default registry with built-in sources
default_registry = SourceRegistry()
default_registry.register('file', FileSystemSource)
default_registry.register('http', HTTPSource)
default_registry.register('https', HTTPSource)
```

## Features
- Singleton default registry
- Allow custom registrations at runtime
- URI parsing with scheme extraction
- Config validation per source type

title: Implement FileSystemSource (refactor existing)
description:
Extract filesystem logic from IndexingService into FileSystemSource class.

## Location
`src/pmd/sources/filesystem.py`

## Current Logic to Extract
From `services/indexing.py:index_collection()`:
- Path resolution and glob pattern matching
- File reading with encoding handling
- Title extraction from markdown
- Change detection via hash comparison

## Implementation
```python
@dataclass
class FileSystemConfig:
    base_path: Path
    glob_pattern: str = '**/*.md'
    encoding: str = 'utf-8'

class FileSystemSource:
    def __init__(self, config: FileSystemConfig):
        self.config = config
    
    def list_documents(self) -> Iterator[DocumentReference]:
        for file_path in self.config.base_path.glob(self.config.glob_pattern):
            if file_path.is_file():
                yield DocumentReference(
                    uri=file_path.as_uri(),
                    path=str(file_path.relative_to(self.config.base_path)),
                    ...
                )
    
    async def fetch_content(self, ref: DocumentReference) -> str:
        # Read file, handle encoding errors
        ...
```

## Backward Compatibility
- Existing collections with pwd/glob_pattern continue to work
- IndexingService delegates to FileSystemSource internally

title: Implement EntitySource with resolver registry
description:
Create pluggable entity URI resolver for custom backends (databases, APIs, etc.).

## Location
`src/pmd/sources/entity.py`

## URI Format
`entity://<resolver>/<resource-type>/<id>[?query]`

Examples:
- `entity://postgres/articles/123`
- `entity://notion/pages/abc-def`
- `entity://custom/projects/42/docs`

## Design
```python
class EntityResolver(Protocol):
    """Protocol for entity resolvers."""
    
    def list_entities(self, resource_type: str, query: dict) -> Iterator[EntityInfo]:
        """List available entities."""
        ...
    
    async def fetch_entity(self, resource_type: str, entity_id: str) -> EntityContent:
        """Fetch entity content."""
        ...

class EntityResolverRegistry:
    """Registry for entity resolvers."""
    _resolvers: dict[str, EntityResolver]
    
    def register(self, name: str, resolver: EntityResolver) -> None
    def get(self, name: str) -> EntityResolver | None

class EntitySource:
    """Document source backed by entity resolvers."""
    
    def __init__(self, uri: str, resolver_registry: EntityResolverRegistry):
        self.resolver_name, self.resource_type, self.query = parse_entity_uri(uri)
        self.resolver = resolver_registry.get(self.resolver_name)
```

## Built-in Resolvers
- None initially (users register their own)
- Document how to create custom resolvers

## Example Custom Resolver
```python
class PostgresResolver:
    def __init__(self, conn_string: str, content_column: str = 'body'):
        ...
    
    async def fetch_entity(self, table: str, id: str) -> EntityContent:
        row = await self.db.fetchone(f'SELECT * FROM {table} WHERE id = ', id)
        return EntityContent(
            content=row[self.content_column],
            title=row.get('title'),
            metadata={'updated_at': row['updated_at']}
        )
```

title: Document Source Abstraction - Multi-URI Support
description:
Enable sourcing documents from multiple backends: filesystem (current), HTTP URLs, and custom entity URIs.

## Goals
- Abstract document sourcing behind a protocol/interface
- Support http:// and https:// URLs
- Support custom entity:// URI schemes with pluggable resolvers
- Maintain backward compatibility with existing filesystem collections

## Key Components
1. DocumentSource protocol
2. Source registry with URI scheme routing
3. FileSystemSource (refactor existing code)
4. HTTPSource with caching/auth support
5. EntitySource with resolver registry
6. Collection model updates for source config
7. Metadata tracking for remote sources

title: Refactor IndexingService to use DocumentSource
description:
Update IndexingService to delegate to DocumentSource implementations.

## Current Flow
```
index_collection(name)
  -> Path(collection.pwd).glob(pattern)
  -> open(file).read()
  -> document_repo.add_or_update()
```

## New Flow
```
index_collection(name)
  -> source = registry.resolve(collection.source_uri, collection.source_config)
  -> for ref in source.list_documents():
       if force or await source.check_modified(ref, stored_hash):
         content = await source.fetch_content(ref)
         document_repo.add_or_update(...)
         metadata_repo.upsert(...)
```

## Changes to IndexingService
1. Inject SourceRegistry in constructor
2. Create source instance from collection config
3. Use source.list_documents() instead of glob
4. Use source.fetch_content() instead of open()
5. Track source metadata for remote sources

## Preserve
- Title extraction logic (move to utility or keep in service)
- FTS indexing logic
- Embedding generation flow
- Error handling and logging

title: Create StatusService for index health reporting
Define integration test cases for pmd.store module
Add authentication/credentials abstraction
description:
Create a secure way to handle credentials for remote sources.

## Location
`src/pmd/sources/auth.py`

## Design
```python
class CredentialProvider(Protocol):
    """Protocol for credential providers."""
    
    async def get_credential(self, key: str) -> str | None:
        """Retrieve a credential by key."""
        ...

class EnvironmentCredentials:
    """Read credentials from environment variables."""
    
    async def get_credential(self, key: str) -> str | None:
        return os.environ.get(key)

class KeyringCredentials:
    """Read credentials from system keyring."""
    
    async def get_credential(self, key: str) -> str | None:
        import keyring
        return keyring.get_password('pmd', key)

class ConfigFileCredentials:
    """Read credentials from encrypted config file."""
    ...
```

## Source Config Integration
```python
# In source config, reference credentials by key
{
    'base_url': 'https://api.example.com',
    'auth_type': 'bearer',
    'auth_token': '$ENV:API_TOKEN'  # or '$KEYRING:api-token'
}
```

## Security Considerations
- Never log or store plaintext credentials
- Support credential rotation
- Clear credentials from memory when done
- Warn about insecure storage methods

title: Add CLI commands for new source types
description:
Extend CLI to support creating and managing collections with different source types.

## New Commands

### collection add (extended)
```bash
# Filesystem (existing, unchanged)
pmd collection add my-docs /path/to/docs --glob '**/*.md'

# HTTP source
pmd collection add web-docs --source=http \
  --url='https://docs.example.com' \
  --sitemap='https://docs.example.com/sitemap.xml' \
  --auth=bearer --token='$DOCS_TOKEN'

# Entity source  
pmd collection add db-docs --source=entity \
  --uri='entity://postgres/articles' \
  --config='connection_string=...'
```

### collection show (new)
```bash
pmd collection show my-docs
# Output:
# Collection: my-docs
#   Source: filesystem
#   Path: /path/to/docs
#   Pattern: **/*.md
#   Documents: 42
#   Last indexed: 2024-01-15T10:30:00Z
```

### source (new subcommand)
```bash
# List available source types
pmd source list

# Test source connectivity
pmd source test --url='https://docs.example.com'

# Register custom entity resolver (via config file)
pmd source register postgres --config=postgres.toml
```

## Implementation
- Update argument parser in cli/commands/collection.py
- Add cli/commands/source.py for source management
- Validate source config before creating collection
